page.title: 05LAND USE AROUND SHEEPHATCH
page.content: In the area the soil is poor and sandy. The major part of the land is rough pasture and the rest supports heathland vegetation. The few private houses that there are, are of a very substantial nature, being finished and maintained to a very high standard indeed.The largest concentration of buildings on the site was until recently used as a residential school. About a year ago About a year ago, it was sold to a religious group and used by them for very large gatherings. Potentially this could have considerable affect in what is essentially a very quiet and sparsely populated district. An overhead power line, supported on metal pylons, passes right through this area. It is a great visual intru- sion in a beautiful landscape.{
